[dscrdvrsc] <Crupti> If you have NVidia Docker 2 and nvidia drivers on your host OS already it should be as simple as
**$ docker run --runtime=nvidia --rm crupti/verushash-ccminer-cuda -a verus -o stratum+tcp://na.luckpool.net:3957 -u VERUS_T_ADDRESS.WORKER**
to download and run ccminer 3.4.

Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Crupti> @Oink Docker is OS portable, so itÂ´s not "Linux Docker" - just Docker. You can use Windows or even UNIX has a host OS as long as you have Docker on it.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Oink> Tnx for the info. Didn't know that. I'll change it. (I'll start thinking on the icon to use... LOL)

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Crupti> Even though the Docker container internally runs Linux, your host OS can be whatever.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Crupti> ThatÂ´s kind of the point and what's neat with Docker, in addition to better security and scalability etc.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Oink> TBH, I hadn't heard of *Docker* before I got into the Verus community.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Crupti> @Oink ItÂ´s basically virtualization software, taken to a new level.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Crupti> Docker runs an OS inside your OS, and in our case, runs the ccminer in the virtualized OS - which also make it more secure as itÂ´s a seperate OS from your physical host OS (which can be whatever, Win, Linux, UNIX)

Author: Gateway#3763

Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Crupti> @Oink Virtual machines, like VMWare, Hyper-V, VirtualBox, etc, usually have horrible miner performance - with Docker I get canÂ´t find any significant performance degregation.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Crupti> @Oink Docker is espesially handy when it comes to mining, I mine multiple coins which miner software all require different OSÂ´s and OS versions, different libraries and library versions, different compilers and compiler versions, etc, without Docker you would have to install new OS and software each time your want to switch coins, with Docker itÂ´s just a single command to switch the coin I want to mine. In addition, I donÂ´t always trust the code of the mining software and Docker runs in itÂ´s own OS which is more secure than running the miner directly from your host OS - with Docker any potential hacker would have to break out of the Docker OS to get access to your host OS, which is hard to do.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Crupti> @Oink You use Docker Volumes instead of VHDÂ´s. Their performance depends on the platform implementation.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Crupti> @Oink ItÂ´s pretty simple to learn Docker. The Dockerfile describes what should be done, if you look at the ccminer Dockerfile then itÂ´s simple to understand. First the FROM command tells it to download a nvidia linux distro that has CUDA 10.1 preinstalled. The first RUN command updates the linux distro in the FROM and installs all the compilers etc - the next RUN line does all the downloading and building of the ccminer software on the linux distro specified in the FROM, then I just create a new on the linux distro in the FROM line so that you wonÂ´t have to run as root - and your basically done. Easy ðŸ˜„

Author: Gateway#3763

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Oink> Biggest problem was usually to get the network drivers running, without hogging all base memory... emm386 couldnâ€™t be used because of the CNC controller that needed to run in real mode.
